jparsec.astrophysics

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.Table

  • public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    A handy class to manipulate 1d/2d/3d tables with measures, including errors and a mask of pixels within calculations, optionally. This class does not provide methods for resampling the data or interpolating, operations that can be achieved using ImageSplineTransform.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    ImageSplineTransform

      • Table

        public Table(java.lang.String[] table,
     java.lang.String separator,
     java.lang.String unit)
        Constructor to read a table from an String array. Values between the separator can be a number or an expression like 'a +/- b', 'a (b)', or even 'a b' to include a as value and b as error.
        Parameters:
        table - The array containing the values to be mapped to a table.
        separator - The separator between the values.
        unit - The unit.

    • Method Detail

      • addMask

        public void addMask(boolean[] mask)
             throws JPARSECException
        Adds a mask to the current table so that operations will not affect those values flagged as 'true' in the input mask.
        Parameters:
        mask - The input mask.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the mask cannot be applied to this table.

      • setUnit

        public void setUnit(java.lang.String unit)
        Changes the unit of the values in this Table to another value.
        Parameters:
        unit - The new unit.

      • addMask

        public void addMask(boolean[][] mask,
           boolean order_ij)
             throws JPARSECException
        Adds a mask to the current table so that operations will not affect those values flagged as 'true' in the input mask.
        Parameters:
        mask - The input mask.
        order_ij - True in case the input mask array is ordered as mask[i][j], where i are the different columns and j the different rows. False for [j][i] ordering. Internally the array is ordered as [j][i].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the mask cannot be applied to this table.

      • addMask

        public void addMask(boolean[][][] mask,
           boolean order_ijk)
             throws JPARSECException
        Adds a mask to the current table so that operations will not affect those values flagged as 'true' in the input mask.
        Parameters:
        mask - The input mask.
        order_ijk - True in case the input mask array is ordered as mask[i][j][k], where i are the different columns and j the different rows, while k different planes. False for [k][j][i] ordering. Internally the array is ordered as [k][j][i].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the mask cannot be applied to this table.

      • addMask

        public void addMask(double lowerLimit,
           double upperLimit,
           boolean includell,
           boolean includeul,
           boolean addMode)
             throws JPARSECException
        Adds a mask for all values in the table within a given range from a lower to an upper limit.
        Parameters:
        lowerLimit - Lower limit.
        upperLimit - Upper limit.
        includell - True to include in the mask values equals to the lower limit.
        includeul - True to include in the mask values equals to the upper limit.
        addMode - True to add the input range to the mask, false to reset the current mask and apply the input.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

         throws JPARSECException

        Throws:

        public void multiply(Table table)

        Throws:

        public boolean isCompatible(Table table)
        Checks if this table is compatible with another one for calculations. Two tables are compatible if they have the same dimensions and sizes, and their units are convertible.
        Parameters:
        table - The other table.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • convolveMap

        public void convolveMap(double beam_x,
               double beam_y,
               double beam_pa)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Convolves the data in the table with a given beam or kernel. This method calls LMVCube.convolveMap(double[][][], double[][], int, int, float[], float, boolean) for both the data and the errors. Mask is not considered in this method.
        Parameters:
        beam_x - Beam major axis size in pixels, for LMVCube.convolveGetGaussianKernel(double, double, double, double, double). Spatial resolution is set to 1 and sampling to 4.
        beam_y - Beam minor size in pixels.
        beam_pa - Beam PA in degrees.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMaximumIndex

        public int[] getMaximumIndex(boolean unique)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the index of the maximum value in the table.
        Parameters:
        unique - True to return null in case there are several positions in the table with the same maximum value, false to return a result (one of those).
        Returns:
        The index positions of the maximum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • set

        public void set(int i,
       int j,
       int k,
       MeasureElement m)
        Sets the value for a given index position. Data array is ordered as data[k][j][i].
        Parameters:
        i - Index for x position, last dimension.
        j - Index for y position, second dimension.
        k - Index for k (plane) index, first dimension.
        m - The new data.

      • get

        public MeasureElement get(int i,
                 int j,
                 int k)
        Returns the value for a given index position. Data array is ordered as data[k][j][i].
        Parameters:
        i - Index for x position, last dimension.
        j - Index for y position, second dimension.
        k - Index for k (plane) index, first dimension.
        Returns:
        data[k][j][i].

      • getData

        public MeasureElement[][][] getData()

        Returns:
        The entire table.

      • getFluxAround

        public Table getFluxAround(double ix,
                  double iy,
                  double rin,
                  double rout,
                  boolean average)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the total flux in a given ring around certain position in the map.
        Parameters:
        ix - Central 'x' position of the ring in the map (last dimension).
        iy - Central 'y' position of the ring in the map (2nd dimension).
        rin - Inner radius of the ring in pixels.
        rout - Outer radius of the ring in pixels.
        average - True to return the average flux instead of the total flux.
        Returns:
        A new table containing one data for each of the planes in the original table. In case of a table of size [3][100][100], returned table will be of size [1][1][3]. For an unique 2d image it will be a single data, size [1][1][1].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • denoise

        public void denoise(int aggressive)
             throws JPARSECException
        Applies a median NEWS filter to remove noise. Based on code by John Burkardt. This method can be called few times to remove noise more effectively.
        Parameters:
        aggressive - Level of denoise intensity, from 0 to 2. The median is applied to a greater size around each pixel for level 2 (up to 21 pixels).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMaximum

        public MeasureElement getMaximum(int column)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the maximum value in the table for a given column (second dimension).
        Parameters:
        column - The column index.
        Returns:
        Maximum value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMinimum

        public MeasureElement getMinimum(int column)
                          throws JPARSECException

        Returns:
        Minimum value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMaximumIndex

        public int[] getMaximumIndex(int column,
                    boolean unique)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the index of the maximum value in the table for a given column.
        Parameters:
        column - The column index.
        unique - True to return null in case there are several positions in the table with the same maximum value, false to return a result (one of those).
        Returns:
        The index positions of the maximum. First value is the plane number, usually 0 for single images, the second the row index.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMinimumIndex

        public int[] getMinimumIndex(int column,
                    boolean unique)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the index of the minimum value in the table for a given column.
        Parameters:
        column - The column index.
        unique - True to return null in case there are several positions in the table with the same minimum value, false to return a result (one of those).
        Returns:
        The index positions of the minimum. First value is the plane number, usually 0 for single images, the second the row index.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • selectElements

        public void selectElements(int plane,
                  int column,
                  double minValue,
                  double maxValue)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Reduces the table to those elements in which the values in certain column are within a given range.
        Parameters:
        plane - The plane or image number, 0 for the first (0 always if there's only one).
        column - The column index.
        minValue - The minimum value for that column so that the row will be preserved.
        maxValue - The maximum value for that column so that the row will be preserved.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • removeElements

        public void removeElements(int plane,
                  int column,
                  double minValue,
                  double maxValue)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Reduces the table to those elements in which the values in certain column are outside a given range.
        Parameters:
        plane - The plane or image number, 0 for the first (0 always if there's only one).
        column - The column index.
        minValue - The minimum value for that column so that the row will be removed.
        maxValue - The maximum value for that column so that the row will be removed.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public MeasureElement[] getColumnValues(int plane,
                               int column)
        Returns a column of the table.
        Parameters:
        plane - Plane or image index.
        column - Column index.
        Returns:
        The set of values for that column and plane.

                   int column,
                   MeasureElement[] val)
        Sets the values for the table in a given plane and column.
        Parameters:
        plane - Plane index.
        column - Column index.
        val - The values to set that plane and column to.

      • getMaskValue

        public boolean getMaskValue(int plane,
                   int column,
                   int row)
        Returns the mask value at certain position.
        Parameters:
        plane - Plane number of the image, usually 0.
        column - Column index.
        row - Row index.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • getDimensions

        public int getDimensions()
        Returns the number of dimensions in this table.
        Returns:
        1, 2, or 3.

      • resample

        public void resample(int max1,
            int max2,
            int max3)
              throws JPARSECException
        Resamples the data to a given number of elements iin each of the three dimensions. The mask is removed.
        Parameters:
        max1 - New number of dimensions in x.
        max2 - New number of dimensions in y.
        max3 - New number of dimensions in z.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • interpolate

        public MeasureElement interpolate(double x,
                         double y,
                         double z)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Interpolates within the data.
        Parameters:
        x - The x index position.
        y - The y index position.
        z - The z index position.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
